item.title: [Book] Fundamentals of Software Architecture - Notes
item.description: Chapter 1: Introduction The four dimensions that define software architecture Structure, the type of the architecture the system is implemented in (microservices, layered, microkernel…). Architecture characteristics, the success criteria of a system, the -ilities (reliability, elasticity, availability, security, agility, fault tolerance, deployability, testability, etc…) Architectural decisions, *the rules *of how a system should be constructed. For example, in a layered architecture the presentation layer can access the database only through the business layer.
